description:
The five members of the Cultural Research Club - Taichi Yaegashi, Iori Nagase, Himeko Inaba, Yui Kiriyama, and Yoshifumi Aoki - encounter a bizarre phenomenon one day when Aoki and Yui switch bodies without warning. The same begins to happen to the other club members, throwing their daily lives into disarray.

At first the five students find some amusement amidst the confusion, but this unwarranted connection also exposes the painful scars hidden within their hearts. As their calm lives are shattered, the relationships between the five students also begin to change...

(Source: Crunchyroll, edited)

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

tags.name: Coming of Age
tags.description: Centers around a character's transition from childhood to adulthood.

tags.name: Body Swapping
tags.description: Centers around individuals swapping bodies with one another.

tags.name: School Club
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a school club scene.

tags.name: Urban Fantasy
tags.description: Set in a world similar to the real world, but with the existence of magic or other supernatural elements.

tags.name: Love Triangle
tags.description: Centered around romantic feelings between more than two people. Includes all love polygons.

tags.name: Primarily Female Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of female characters.

tags.name: Age Regression
tags.description: Prominently features a character who was returned to a younger state.

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Gender Bending
tags.description: Prominently features a character who dresses and behaves in a way characteristic of another gender, or has been transformed into a person of another gender.

tags.name: Ensemble Cast
tags.description: Features a large cast of characters with (almost) equal screen time and importance to the plot.

tags.name: Tsundere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who acts cold and hostile in order to mask warmer emotions.

tags.name: Philosophy
tags.description: Relating or devoted to the study of the fundamental nature of knowledge, reality, and existence.

tags.name: LGBTQ+ Themes
tags.description: Prominently features characters or themes associated with the LGBTQ+ community, such as sexuality or gender identity.

title.native: ココロコネクト ミチランダム

node.description:
**Doujin Circle:** CLOSED/UNDERGROUND.  

She has been friend and has formed groups with Haruka Shimotsuki and Chata for a long time.  She started working in the fields as a vocal, net seiyuu, composer and lyricist when she first started high school. In 2004, she released the album "Min no Uta" as her major debut. In 2006, the ending theme to Higurashi no Naku Koro ni, "Why, or why not", marked her debut as an anime song artist.

[Website](http://www.eufonius.net/)

Japanese progressive rock music group which debuted on October 11, 2003.

__Members:__
[Hajime Kikuchi](https://anilist.co/staff/104846/Hajime-Kikuchi) (菊地創) - composition and arrangement
[riya](https://anilist.co/staff/267603) (りや) - vocals and lyrics
Susumu Ookubo (大久保将) - Supporting member

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/大沼心) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shin_Oonuma)

After graduating from Chiyoda Institute of Technology he joined Office AO where he worked as an animator. He later joined Shaft in 2004 as a subcontractor, and he became [Akiyuki Shinbou's](https://anilist.co/staff/100089/) right hand until 2009. When he stopped working for Shaft, he found his new home at studio Silver Link, where he is to-date known as their most prominent director. Noted for directing shows such as [ef: A Tale of Melodies](https://anilist.co/anime/4789/), [Baka to Test](https://anilist.co/anime/6347/) and [Kokoro Connect](https://anilist.co/anime/11887/).

Oonuma is known to like so called moe games.

He began playing classical piano at the age of 5 and learned other instruments from his experience playing with a brass band (flute) and rock band (drums). After graduating from the Nihon University College of Arts he worked as a composer at KOEI, working on the music for a number of their games. He left the company in 2006 and has since been composing for TV, anime, and movies.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/dochibibi) Yukiko Horiguchi is an animator, illustrator and character designer formerly belonging to Kyoto Animation. She joined Kyoto Animation in 2003 after graduating from a junior college (tanki daigaku). She started as inbetweener on Shin-Chan, before making a debut as key animator on the KyoAni in-house OVA Munto. In 2007 she was given the chance to design characters for the anime adaptation of the Lucky Star yon-koma manga. Horiguchi is particularly known for the shape she gives her drawings, resulting in a certain roundness and the distinctly fine outline and peculiar shading. Her characters appear to be very child-like and cute, and full of energy, which is a major appeal to the fans. The illustrator [BUNBUN](https://anilist.co/staff/112785) is her younger brother.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/志茂文彦) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fumihiko_Shimo)

Noted for writing the scripts for Kyoto Animation's anime adaptations of Key visual novels.

Began his career as a production assistant on [Grave of the Fireflies](https://anilist.co/anime/578/), but switched to writing right after.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/志茂文彦) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fumihiko_Shimo)

Noted for writing the scripts for Kyoto Animation's anime adaptations of Key visual novels.

Began his career as a production assistant on [Grave of the Fireflies](https://anilist.co/anime/578/), but switched to writing right after.
[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/亀山俊樹)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/dekopongas)

Affiliated with [P.A. Works](https://anilist.co/studio/132/).

Brother of [Kousuke Kawatsura](https://anilist.co/staff/116501/).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/nocturamayama)

Yamashita graduated from Kokugakuin University with a Major in History. He first started out in the industry in 1997 as a production assistant at JCF. Amazingly, he has never been formally trained in art. His talent for drawing was first discovered through various doodles and sketches he would make on company paperwork.

Yamashita's first project as an animator was on [the second Kochikame movie](https://anilist.co/anime/3547/). Some time later he went freelance. [Samurai Champloo](https://anilist.co/anime/205/) was the first project he worked on freelance. Around 2006, Yamashita joined [Bee Train](https://anilist.co/studio/5/) and started work as character designer and animation director on the TV show [Ginyuu Mokushiroku Meine Liebe Wieder](https://anilist.co/anime/771/). A short while later, the animation department at Bee Train was spun off into new company, [C-Station](https://anilist.co/studio/6074/), and Yamashita moved with it. Today he retains a seat at C-Station, but regularly contracts out to work on various external projects.

__Place of Birth:__ Osaka Prefecture, Japan

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/庵田定夏)
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/371954143)
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/Amichanwakannai)

Team.Nekokan [Neko] (Team.ねこかん[猫]), literally "canned cat," is a independent J-rock band known for their video game-themed tracks. The "[猫]" in their name represents their namesake; the brackets being an "E-can," or energy can, borrowed from the video game series Rockman (known as Megaman internationally), while the symbol 猫 (neko) means "cat".  Members: nyanyannya (or ねこ) - Vocals Sham (シャム) - Guitar

Hiromi Mizutani is a composer and arranger from Nagoya, Japan.  In addition to Zill O'll -infinite- and Yuusha 30, Hiromi Mizutani also composed music for the game Red Seeds Profile, known as Deadly Premonition outside of Japan.  He is a member of Team-MAX along with Yasuharu Takanashi, Kenji Fujisawa, Hiroshi Motofuji, Shuji Katayama and REMI.

In addition to Zill O'll -infinite- and Yuusha 30, Hiromi Mizutani also composed music for the game Red Seeds Profile, known as Deadly Premonition outside of Japan.  He is a member of Team-MAX along with Yasuharu Takanashi, Kenji Fujisawa, Hiroshi Motofuji, Shuji Katayama and REMI.
__Hobbies:__ football

Married to [Yukiko Aikei](https://anilist.co/staff/110945).
